name: The Allin 1979 - Standard Stan Butler model.
description:
The Allin 'Standard Stan Butler model' frame-set.

This  custom built beautifully chromed frame set was built in 1979, by Allin cycles in Croydon. It's made from Reynolds 531 tubing with Campagnolo dropouts, Haden lugs and a Haden fork crown.


This particular frame is featured on the classic lightweights 'Allin' page:
www.classiclightweights.co.uk/builders/allin.html


Can be built up to customer requirements please enquire via contact page.






Details:

Frame Type: Road
Material: Steel
Tubing: 531


Size:

name: Sargent and Co Musette
description:
Christmas is here at sargent and co, we have received our first batch of our very own premium quality canvas screenprinted musette bags.

First 25 purchased are entered in to our prize draw* to win a medium sized race weight yellow le coq sportif jersey just like the one worn by Froome in this years tour de france, Kindly donated to us by le coq themselves.

Also as an extra treat if you come in store to buy, Christmas drinks are on us. 
Rob will give you a free bottle of home brewed ginger beer by square root london.

Only while stocks last as we have one crate and a very thirsty Rob.

*Competition info: 
First twenty five bags are numbered in side and winners will be drawn the weekend before christmas.

Bag Details:

Fair Trade Eco-Bag 
100% Cotton Canvas 
38cm x 29cm / 15in x 11.5in 
Long Messenger Handle 
Country of origin: India 
Made from a sustainable crop in a Fair Trade Factory 
Printed in the UK

name: Le Coq Sportif / Oi Polloi
description:
A custom build for le coq sportif and Oi polloi to race in next years L'Eroica.


Bicycle Details:

Ken Ryall Frame.

Frame: Reynolds 531, custom Chromed Ends
Fork: Reynolds 531, custom Chromed Ends

Seatpost: Campagnolo Nuovo Record Twin bolt
Saddle: Brooks Professional Large copper rivet
Headset: Tange
Chainset: Stronglight Chainset w/ TA chainrings
Bottom Bracket: Stronglight Bottom Bracket
Pedals: MKS 
Front Derailleur: Campagnolo Super Record 
Rear Derailleur: Campagnolo Nuovo Record
Gear Shifter: Campagnolo Valentino Extra 
Brakes: Mafac Dural Forge Brake Set
Hubs: Campagnolo Record Large Flange 
Rims: Record Rims
Stem: GB Spear-point Stem
Bars: GB Randonneur Handlebars
Bar tape: Brooks leather bartape - honey
Tyres: Continental sprinter tubular tyre
Cable guides: Campagnolo toptube cable clips

Additional:

Custom made head badge and decals.


Competition:

To mark the arrival of their latest L'Eroica race jerseys, Oi Polloi have  teamed up with @lecoqsportif for an Instagram competition to win a bundle of official L'Eroica gear. 

This sporty two-wheeled number is the Cottonopolis L'Eroica race bike currently on display in the shop (manchester), Snap a photo of the bike in the shop and upload it to Instagram over the next month with the hashtag #LCSOIPOLLOI and you'll be automatically entered to win.

name: Gold Helmet
description:
Black isn’t necessarily a sensible or flattering colour for a helmet. This one has a very slim profile that compliments every face shape and a super-reflective finish that is both chic and mega-visible. It’s no surprise that these helmets are faves in style mags and on the street. Our friend Rosie was pedalling along in hers when Gok Wan hung out of a passing car shouting “nice helmet!”.

We say: blondes go with silver and brunettes go with gold, but we’ll let you decide. Either way, you’ll be flying along like a hot robot.

Features:

Two sizes: S/M & M/L
High-impact ABS shell
Integrated EPS liner with soft interior padding
Industry standard safety helmet. EN1078, CPSC
Weight 430g

name: Bobbin Bramble
description:
The Bramble is a Bobbin at a war-time price, without compromising on quality or weight.

The inspiration for the Bramble comes from the Coventry-made Triumphs beloved by Land Girls and English district nurses in the interwar years up until the 1950s. It’s easily customisable and can take a rear rack or basket, while an ample ration of 6 gears is good for hillier areas.



Summary:

Colours: Green Gold / Plum
Frame: Steel, Sizes 17″, 19″ & 21″
Wheels: Nippy 26″
Gears: 6 speed Shimano

Specifications:

Frame: Hi-ten & Cromoly
Sizes: 17”,19” & 21”
Weight : Approx 12kg
Handlebars: Chrome plated
Stem: Quill Stem
Grips: Vinyl stitched
Gear Shifter: Shimano 6 speed trigger
Chainguard: Painted Steel
Crank: Chrome plated steel
Gears: 6 speed Shimano
Brakes: Tektro alloy side pull
Wheels: 26”
Tyres: Kenda Gumwall 26 x 1 3/8
Saddle: Vinyl Brown
Seatpost: Chrome plated steel
Kickstand: Alloy
Mudguards: Painted Steel

Please contact us for availability before ordering. 

Available to pick up built from the shop or can be delivered, but will require some assembly.

Please allow up to 3 Sargent and co working days for your order.

name: Chrome Rear Carrier Rack
description:
This super-stylish slimline chrome steel carrier rack is used on our Hummingbird and Kingfisher. It’s available separately for £29 and is perfect for the Bobbin Scout, Madam & Monsieur, as well as 2012 rack-less Bramble models.

It comes in two sizes: small for 26″ wheels or large for 700c wheels.  The maximum load is 18kg.

The rack has been designed with city bikes in mind and both sizes have adjustable stays. It’s compatible with other brands of bikes, provided the frame has standard rack mounts (note – we can’t guarantee this though, as all bikes are set up in different ways).

name: Bronx Metropole
description:
Built just like a traditional bicycle, the Metropole is the lightest in its class and a pleasure to ride. 

Sargent and Co have been selling 'Her' for four years and we thoroughly recommend it.

Great Value for money.

Available in Olive, Black and Maroon:

Wheel Size: 26”
Frame: Hi-Ten classic
Forks: Hi-Ten tubular crown
Gearset: Shimano 6 speed with Shimano Gripshift
Brakeset: Alloy Tektro side pull 
Wheelset: Alloy with Formula hubs, 26 x 1 3/8 tyres
Controls: Classic steel bars and quill stem
Size: 17”/19”/21”
Weight: 13.5kg

Please contact us for availability before ordering. 

Available to pick up built from the shop or can be delivered, but will require some assembly.

*Basket is not included in the price but we have a decent selection of baskets in different shape, sizes and shades of brown.

Please allow 3 Sargent and co working days for your order.

name: Retro Front Light
description:
The perfect front light for all retro & vintage-style bikes, this battery-powered LED beauty will get you home safe and looks very smart. Its an easy way to replace conked-out / ancient dynamo lights. Get the old-fashioned look on the outside, but modern functionality on the inside!  Light supplied with brake bolt mounting bracket.

Features:
2 AA batteries
Flashing mode for extra visibility
Coated steel mounting bracket

More information:

For flashing mode, hold the button down for 5 seconds whilst on.

Please note: light is designed for use on retro/vintage bikes with steel forks.
The bracket is for mounting the light in-between the calliper brake and the front fork.
To fit the light you must remove the front brake. If you are unsure how to do this, we strongly recommend paying a bike mechanic to do it for you. We are not responsible for incorrectly fitted lights.

We cannot guarantee this light will fit bikes with v-brakes, basket brackets or front racks.

This light must not be used on bikes with:
Short-drop calliper road brakes
Cantilever brakes
Brakes with short, recessed hex bolts
Carbon forks
Aluminium frames

The light bracket is flat. Your fork is rounded. You must place the rounded washer from your brake in-between the two or you will snap the bracket. Order of mounting from front to back:
Brake
Standard washer
Light bracket
Rounded washer
Fork
(back of fork) Washer, Nut

name: Chromed French frame. c.1970s
description:
Beautifully crafted very lightweight french road bicycle frame. Open windowed spear point lugs have been filed down which is a sign of good craftsmanship as this keeps the frame very light weight.

It's been well loved and ridden; marked and scratched from use and has some signs of age; rust on the top tube underneath the paint. But it is a real beauty and very high end build.

name: Dawes Galaxy Touring Bicycle
description:
An all time touring favorite, the Dawes galaxy is a renowned classic.


"Generations have passed, empires have crumbled and George Hincapie's varicose veins have finally retired, but the Dawes Galaxy is still trundling around the globe bringing colourful panniers and expedition beards to grateful villagers in far-flung parts - and if someone hasn't started a travel memoir with the words 'a long time ago and on a Galaxy far, far away' then they jolly well should."

Roadcc.

name: Le Jeune 'Vainqueur du tour de france' c.1970s
description:
Very fine french road frame, painted in Lejeune team colours with Celebratory Champion 'Tour de France' stickers; The bicycles of Marcel LeJeune were very prominent in the pro peleton in the 1960s & 70s.

The down tube sticker has a small scratch, other wise the frame is in superb condition and Includes the original 'LIGHTRACE' Headset.

name: H. E. GREEN TRACK FRAME 1956
description:
H. E. GREEN TRACK / ROAD PATH FRAME


A very collectable, ‘Hand built Lightweight' track frame. Built in 1956 by H.E. Green, (South West London). H. E. 'Doc' Green trained at A.S. Gillot, alongside Ron Cooper. 

Lots of interesting history on: 
http://www.classiclightweights.co.uk/builders/hegreen.html



Can be built up to customer requirements please enquire via contact page.

name: GANNA ROAD FRAME c.1950
description:
GANNA ROAD FRAME c.1950


A typically robust italian frame; built by the famous Italian builder 'Ganna' founded in the early 20th Century by Luigi Ganna: An italian legend. Luigi Ganna was the overall winner of the first  Giro d'Italia, held in 1909. His Robust frames are 


"A young seventeen year old Luigi Ganna, every morning, he went by bicycle from Induno Olona to Milan to do a bricklayer, with a bag attached to the handlebars, with a loaf of bread and a bottle of sugar water diluted with a little 'of wine. Sun, rain or snow that was each day walked 100 km cycling through dirt roads and a large number of holes. "

(A excerpt from a biography on the Ganna Website: http://www.biciclette-ganna.it/)


Frame Details:

Frame Number: 450B
Frame Type: Road
Material: Steel
Tubing: Robust Italian Steel


Size

Seat Tube (C-T):  54.5 cm
Top Tube (C-C):  57 cm


Dropout spacing

Rear: -  120 mm
Front: -  100 mm


Details

Lug style: CHROMED HEAD LUGS
Seat stays: -
Fork Crowns:  CHROMED FORK CROWN
Dropout orientation: HORIZONTAL


Includes
Headset - [condition]




Braze-Ons

Mudguard eyelets
top tube cable stops
Downtube cable stops
Chainstay cable stops
Pump pegs

*Chainset - Comes with a very rare triple chainset with 'Ganna' pantograph. The list price does not include chainset and Bottom Bracket.

description:

Bikes are kept in running condition for trial but are supplied re-built and sized to customer, with a full years warranty. This is included in listed price.

name: Peugeot
description:
Will come supplied fully serviced, with new porteur bars.

From a very lovely gentleman named Pascal who arrived at our door having cycled all the way from switzerland to sell us his bicycle. He said "I like to make holidays on my bike", and doubled  the money rob gave him and gave it to a children's charity.
